title: It’s a win win
text: This app is awesome. My family has used it a few times for donuts, cookies and late night dinners. Not only is it always a great value and delicious, it eliminates waste. If the restaurant is unable to donate the food this is the next best alternative. 5 stars!

title: Great Deals & Less Waste - Genius
text: Love this app and have used it to try various local places at a steep discount. They are expanding to new locations all the time, if you live in a larger city this app is a must. Love ordering when I have visitors in town, pastries and cold pressed juice for everyone!

title: My new favorite service
text: The idea is so good I wish I thought of it! The service is great, I love the surprise bag aspect of it and saving food from waste feels great too. I’m surprised that more people don’t know about this in San Francisco yet, but I think it will get popular soon.

title: great way to discover places
text: sometimes I will buy something extra if I really like the establishment. this is a win-win type of app, where you win in more ways than just one sometimes.

title: Best way to eat around Boston!
text: I live in Boston and the food scene can be a little pricey. I love this app but you do have to be a bit quick with it because some restaurants sell out quickly. I’m really excited to try more restaurants now that I can actually afford to eat out more!

title: Doing my part
text: I just love the idea of preventing unnecessary food waste. I receive quality food at a great value. Food does not end up in the garbage, plus the money I pay is donated to the Northern Illinois food bank. This is a win-win-win! Thank you Too Good To Go!

title: Store ran out
text:
I was so excited to use this app. Then the very first time I did, I go 20 minutes out of my way to pickup a meal at 9pm.

When I showed up, they told me they had run out of food. So I left empty handed and then got a message from To Good to Go support telling me that it might be a while to get my refund because they have a backlog of support requests… sounds like others are experiencing the same issue.

Save yourself the hassle and stay away.

title: Just impossible to use
text:
The map and location targeting isn’t easy to use — so you end up with a bunch of tiles which you don’t know if they’re a couple minutes away or in another state. I live in NJ and it keeps picking up in NY where the more adoption but unless you’re familiar with the places you’ve no idea what you’re getting or where to go

Nice idea but brutal implementation - I feel like the learning curve requires you to familiarize yourself with everything in your 20 mi radius - which absolutely defeats the purpose

The right thing at the right place at the right time - if you can’t do that you should be deploying apps ….

Have been trying this for 2 months now with friend and we haven’t bought a single thing

title: Pastries and pizza
text:
The app is fine. The problem is that 70% of the stores are coffeehouses and bakeries, 20% are pizzerias, and the rest are miscellaneous. If you’re into baked goods and pizza, you’re all set. Otherwise, you’ll starve trying to order food from this app.

Note that I tried a few locations in LA with the same result. It’s a little better in SF but really not that much.

title: GOOD FOR YOU, THE BUSINESS, AND THE EARTH
text: This app is such a great idea to reduce food waste, save money, and give businesses (especially small businesses) to make a little extra money instead of throwing away food. I love what they are doing with this app. Plus saves me money as a college student :)

title: Great app
text:
Thanks to this app, I've been saving money on delicious items and getting a bit more exercise walking to local spots.

For a good experience, avoid driving many miles out of your way - stick to local places.

title: Unreliable orders, waste of a trip, like a lottery
text: I thought this was a good concept, so I downloaded it and placed my first order. After I left my house, my order was cancelled and I didn’t find out until I arrived. Wasted a trip and received nothing. This is like a lottery. If you’re okay wasting your time and gas hoping you might get something when you arrive just to save a couple dollars, give it a try and cross your fingers. I wouldn’t hold my breath if I were you!

title: One Problem and Unfortunately it’s the Biggest One.
text: I feel like what the developers are doing with this is is truly amazing and wonderful, there’s just one problem, and I don’t know if it’s something that they can control or if it’s something that just takes time. I just need the app to be available in my area(Lakeland, Florida).

title: Very happy so far
text: Very seamless and easy to use. A good amount of food for only 5$. I wish the pick up times were a bit longer and that there are more options, but hoping with time, more restaurants will sign up. A very sustainable way to combat food waste.

title: Great idea but app needs some more features
text: In NYC a 2 miles radius to search for food is actually a lot, would be nice to have 1 mile radius search option AND be able to view restaurants/shops on a map instead of only on a list and having to figure out where each location is individually.

title: Great value for a good cause
text: We have really enjoyed trying different eateries in our neighborhood and helping to reduce food waste — then going back to buy full price when we find a spot we like. It’s a great app with good value and when one shop was unexpectedly closed, I was promptly refunded.

title: So far it’s great
text: Found a place within only a couple of minutes of walking distance of my own home. The food was good and I really love not only the value but the idea of saving this food from going to the trash

title: Love the great value
text: This is a fun way to try new things and support local businesses. I have tried businesses I didn't know about through this app and will be back to them. Fun app and more businesses are joining in my area.

title: Surprise Bags!
text: I just wanted to take this opportunity to thank the places that participate with this app. I picked up my second surprise bag ever and it is loaded to the brim with lots of delicious stuff! I’m having a lot of fun with this and I like the idea that it’s such a win-win.

title: Genius idea
text: What a great way to support small businesses AND prevent food waste! Hopefully more restaurants will become available closer to my end of town but for the value on the two orders ive already picked up I dont mind the drive if I have time.

title: Need filter or search within Favorites to find items faster instead of scrolling.
text: When I review the details of the TGTG in Favorites and I navigate back, it takes me back to the top of the Favorites list.

title: Very honor to joining this vibe !!
text: I’m not sure exactly when I watched it from social media only for uk and eu. However now I got it from NY such a grateful and i got great value of bread from my number one bakery such good vibe and wish they have more stores and restaurants on the app!! :))))

title: Unfortunate
text: I loved the idea of this app and not wasting food and was looking forward to using the app for the first time only to discover it hasn’t expanded in the area yet which was extremely disappointing and I can’t wait for this app to be available for use in my area!

title: Eat like a king!
text: This app has saved me so much money, I wasn’t even worried about my parking ticket because of it. Meals that usually cost 15-25$ are going for only $4-$6.50 in San Francisco! I wish they were in Eureka. I’d love to go around and get restaurants on board.

title: What’s the point?
text:
I’m sure that it’s a great app for areas that it actually supports, but I’d like to know what areas those are. I’ve set my search area to 20 miles and tried multiple large cities throughout my state with no luck. 
I’d tried this app a few years ago with the same results and deleted it. I optimistically download it again in the hopes that they’d expanded their bubble. As stated earlier, they haven’t. So here we go again - delete and maybe try again in a couple of years.

title: Allergen warning, whats the point
text:
When the business marks ‘surprise bag’ they don’t have to disclose possible allergens. The allergy button is simply. Of course every business marks ‘surprise bag’, they don’t know end of the day inventory. Y’all need to give subcategories for surprise bags, prompt businesses to disclose allergens, or remove some of the mystery of a surprise bag.

If i want to save money and the earth by buying left over groceries, I should at least be able to ensure it’s not a bag of peanuts.

title: Looking forward to more restaurants joining
text: Love that there’s an app focused on helping eliminate food waste! Today was my first time using and not the last. I am looking forward to more restaurants joining as my area only had 2 participating.

title: New favorite app
text:
This app is great, especially if you are a night owl and eat dinner when restaurants are closing and live in a neighborhood with amazing restaurants. 

Marketing for this app should focus on food value not necessarily just “save food waste”.  Best deals in NYC right here.

title: Delancey Bagels
text: I Received a text of the offer while I was in the area. I clicked and clicked and paid on line Apple Pay. What a huge bag and assortment of bagels and sweet cakes I received s washer I walked in. I look forward to another visit. This was well worth the cost a great value.

title: Brilliant Idea and 5 star for just the Initiative!
text: I don’t really write reviews. Infact I did not even start using the app. Just downloaded it after watching an instagram ad. Proud of the initiative. I always hated wasting food as many in the world cannot afford a meal. This is a wonderful start up to reduce the wastage. Thanks!

title: Money-saver tool right here
text: I’m a grad student on a budget and this app helps me save a lot of money. I pay half the price I usually would for restaurant food, and it saves the day when I’m in between meal preps and I need something asap.

title: Need more stores in my area
text: Great concept! Just collected my first bag. It was fast and easy and an excellent value. Unfortunately there are only a few stores in my area that participate, which is odd since I live in a major city.

title: Le Our Daily Bread!
text: I was so eager to try out the app but more importantly to see how my experience will be . It was just great! And we got to save some of that delicious food! What’s even better I get to share it with some other people on the street!

title: Good Quality Food for the Price
text: I have never had a store I’ve picked up food at that wasn’t delicious. Each store has given a good amount of food for the price paid and best part is the food isn’t wasted!

title: Good concept but not for people who dont drive
text:
Good concept but it needs a delivery function. Not everyone can drive nor does everyone have access to public transit. Still a nice idea though.

Welp no stores in my area anymore. The place that has the surprise bag is over an hour away and I can only pick it up after 9:30pm. Nope. Keep it.

title: Awesome App
text:
Heard about this app from a family member and I decided to give it a try and it has been an awesome experience so far.
You can’t go wrong and you’re saving food from going to waste. Just an awesome concept.

title: Poor notification system
text:
I’d LOVE to be able to get store-specific notifications, especially for the ones I favorited (as I thought that was the purpose of favoriting a store). I always miss bags for the stores I’m interested in, so it’d be great if the app made things fairer somehow...
Also, it’d be great if the individual stores had set times for when they launch surprise bags. Just my opinion

title: Love getting cheap food!lol
text: Think it’s a brilliant idea and should become law to minimize food waste. The app is really simple to use. Only wish there were more restaurants, which I’m sure will eventually happen in time.

title: Addicted
text: I don’t know what I was doing without this app, but Iv had local food pickup and went with family to another… I’m obsessed. Great food, great quality, awesome portions and most importantly I’m NOT leaving my bank account dry!!! ALSO I’m severely low income, so this app is LUXURY!

title: Hit or miss. Not a lot of support
text: There’s a real hit or miss loop with this app. Sometimes it’s an amazing value, from my experience it’s been more duds than hits. The support seems none existent and the notifications haven’t been working very well. Check Reddit and to see if your City has a very well run program or is just a dumping app

title: Love this app just one minor thing
text: I love this app! I’m a software designer so I suggest one thing. Please make sure you make it known to not press the button before you get to the attendant who’s giving you your order.

title: Great idea!! Needs more locations!
text: I’m in a city in Ohio, so I haven’t been able to use this app yet, but I love love love the philosophy! Stores and restaurants throw away so much food at the end of the night and people should be able to purchase it instead of it being trashed!! Please come to Ohio !! This should be implemented into every city in the US.

title: Too Good to Go
text: Thus far we have tried two new establishments. One has been around for decades but we had never gone there. Will be a regular and the other was a new place. Again very good. Love trying new spots

title: Great app, subpar UI
text: I love the concept, and I love how easy it is to find participating restaurants. But at the same time, the app can be difficult to navigate at times, like for example: I was not able to find my previous orders to grab an order number, because the “Your Orders” section is indicated by a stylized bag icon with a number beside it.

title: Different items
text: I tried the service twice and received different items each time. The value was good, but I was hoping for some  produce also.

title: a great app
text: I bought a lot of good food for a small amount of money. So grateful to the people who created and are maintaining this great app. It brings a lot of value, helps people who don't have much money, saves money, saves resources

title: Great way to get a deal
text: It’s legit. I have used this app since my area has started using the app at just one coffee shop. Now the Sacramento area keeps adding more places to this app. It’s fun to have a surprise and try new places cuz of this app!

title: Save money and prevent food waste
text: If you like surprises and can eat a variety of foods, this works well. The only issue I’ve had is restaurants changing or canceling orders after I’ve already left to pick it up.

title: Great Cause
text: I love that this helps save good food/items that could just potentially be thrown away or left to rot in a landfill.  You also can’t beat the price for the amount you receive back. Love using this app!

title: Loved it
text: This app idea so good it makes me think why on earth i never think about it. Overall this app is amazing but there need to be an option in the surprise bag because i want to reserve from some restaurants but i don't eat pork and it scares me if i order i would lose my money because they might give me a pork.
